revised_title: Effects of Castration and Ovariotomy on Sheep: A Study on Hormone Influence
tldr: The study examines the effects of castration and ovariotomy on sheep, discovering that the development of horns in rams is dependent on a stimulus from the testes. Castration stops horn growth, while ovariotomy does not appear to lead to the assumption of male characters in female sheep. The research provides insight into the role of hormones in sheep development and reproductive biology.
